Description.val:
Modernized LSD 41/49 Class ships transport and launch amphibious craft and vehicles with their crews and embarked personnel in amphibious assault operations. Supporting amphibious operations include landings via Landing Craft, Air Cushion (LCAC), conventional landing craft, and helicopters, onto hostile shores.

LSD Phase Modernization for LSD 41, 42 and 46 was funded with SMOSF prior to FY18.  For FY 2018+, this funding shifted from SMOSF to the base budget.  LSD 46 USS Tortuga Midlife is being installed as the LSD Modernization program.  The LSD 46 Modernization program replaces obsolete/unsupported HM&E systems and legacy C5I systems, and implements TOC savings upgrades to maintain amphibious warfare capabilities through DECOM (2038).  These include items such as LPAC, Steering Control Systems (SCS), A/C-plants, Generators, Propulsion Load Management Units (PLMU), Reverse Osmosis (RO) Desalinators, Automated Digital Network System (ADNS), Battle Force Tactical Network (BFTN), Digital Modular Radio (DMR), Global Broadcast System (GBS), Information Systems Security Program (KMI and KW46), Naval Modular Automated Communications System (NAVMACS), Advanced Digital Antenna Production (ADAP), Navy Multiband Terminal (NMT), CRYPTO, Ship Self Defense System (SSDS) Upgrade suite, Interior Communications (IC) Systems and Davit Upgrade.

The LSD 41 USS Whidbey Island and LSD 42 USS Germantown will be inducted into Modernization in FY2020 and FY2024, respectively, which will provide for a 5-year service life extension.

[P40A / ST001 LSD MOD C4I System]: LSD 41, LSD 42, LSD 46 Phased Modernization upgrades of C4I System including equipment procurement, Design Services Agent (DSA), Alteration Installation Team (AIT), Shipyard installation, recurring equipment engineering, equipment integration, and ILS requirements.  Ship Alterations: ADNS, BFTN, DMR, GBS, KMI/KW46, NAVMACS, ADAP, NMT, CRYPTO, CANES, and VACM.

[P40A / Automated Digital Network System (ADNS)]: Procures Automated Digital Network System (ADNS) for LSD Phased Mod ships including equipment procurement, system engineering, equipment integration, and Integrated Logistics Support (ILS). ADNS supplies the tactical wide area network (WAN) component of the naval communications system, providing surface, ship, submarine, airborne, tactical-shore, and shore based Wide Area network (AWN) gateway services management.

[P40A / Battle Force Tactical Network (BFTN)]: Procures Battle Force Tactical Network (BFTN) for LSD Phased Mod ships including equipment procurement, system engineering, equipment integration, and Integrated Logistics Support (ILS).

[P40A / Digital Modular Radio (DMR)]: Procures Digital Modular Radio (DMR) for LSD Phased Mod ships including equipment procurement, system engineering, equipment integration, and Integrated Logistics Support (ILS).

[P40A / Global Broadcast System (GBS)]: Procures Global Broadcast System (GBS) for LSD Phased Mod ships including equipment procurement, system engineering, equipment integration, and Integrated Logistics Support (ILS).

[P40A / Information Systems Security Program  (KMI and KW46)]: Procures Information Systems Security Program  (KMI and KW46) for LSD Phased Mod ships including equipment procurement, system engineering, equipment integration, and Integrated Logistics Support (ILS).

[P40A / Naval Modular Automated Communications System (NAVMACS)]: Procures Naval Modular Automated Communications System (NAVMACS) for LSD Phased Mod ships including equipment procurement, system engineering, equipment integration, and Integrated Logistics Support (ILS).

[P40A / Advanced Digital Antenna Production (ADAP)]: Procures Advanced Digital Antenna Production (ADAP) for LSD Phased Mod ships including equipment procurement, system engineering, equipment integration, and Integrated Logistics Support (ILS).

[P40A / Navy Multiband Terminal (NMT)]: Procures Navy Multiband Terminal (NMT) for LSD Phased Mod ships including equipment procurement, system engineering, equipment integration, and Integrated Logistics Support (ILS).

[P40A / CRYPTO]: Procures Cryptologic equipment for communication security for LSD Phased Mod ships including equipment procurement, system engineering, equipment integration, and Integrated Logistics Support (ILS).

[P40A / CANES]: Procures Consolidated Afloat Network and Enterprise Services (CANES) for LSD Phased Mod ships including equipment procurement, system engineering, equipment integration, and Integrated Logistics Support (ILS).  CANES is the Navy's next-generation tactical afloat network provides a common computing environment, which includes an adaptable information technology platform that can rapidly meet changing warfighting requirements.

[P40A / VINSON/ANDVT Cryptographic Modernization (VACM)]: Procures VINSON/ANDVT Cryptographic Modernization (VACM) for LSD Phased Mod ships including equipment procurement, system engineering, equipment integration, and Integrated Logistics Support (ILS).

[P40A / ST001 - LSD MOD Combat System]: Modernizes LSD 41 and LSD 42 during Phase Modernization Period with upgraded Combat System suites.

[P40A / AN/SLQ-32]: Upgrades AN/SLQ-32 Electronic Warfare (EW) system.

[P40A / Navigation Sensor System Interface (NAVSSI)]: Upgrades AN/SSN-6 Navigation Sensor System Interface (NAVSSI) System.

[P40A / Ship Self Defense System (SSDS)]: Upgrades Ship Self Defense System (SSDS) MK2 Combat System equipment.

[P40A / Rolling Airframe Missile (RAM)]: Upgrades Rolling Airframe Missile (RAM).

[P40A / Combat Ship System Qualification Trials (CSSQT)]: Combat Systems Ship Qualifications Trials consists of aircraft flight and re-fueling services, Air Warfare/Surface Warfare/Under Sea Warfare range services and support, scenario data recording and data analysis.

[P40A / ST001 - LSD Mod HM&E Modernization]: LSD Modernization Hull Mechanical and Electrical (HM&E) Modernization upgrades for LSD 41 and LSD 49 Class.

[P40A / LSD HM&E Cyber Resiliency]: HM&E cyber resiliency shipalts on LSD-41 class ships.  The shipalts would each include a Boundary Defense Capability (BDC), a central HM&E Situational Awareness (SA) tool, TAPs into HM&E data flow and weasel boards on the backplanes of select HM&E equipment providing the capabilities required to detect anomalous activity, react by segmenting the shipboard network and restore to normal operating conditions.

[P40A / LSD HM&E Cyber Resiliency (DSA / Install)]: FY21 DSA for 2 installations in FY22 of Cyber Security Resiliency Procurements in FY21.

[P40A / Damage Control Console (DCC) Upgrade]: Upgrades Damage Control Console (DCC) hardware by replacing legacy DCC with PLC based control systems and Human Machine Interface (HMIs) for user monitoring and control.

[P40A / Bus Tie Circuit Breaker Replace 2000Amp]: Replaces legacy Whipp & Bourne Bus Tie Circuit Breakers with industry standard (non-ruggedized) DRS circuit breakers.

[P40A / SSDG Circuit Breaker Replace 4000Amp]: Replaces legacy Whipp & Bourne Ship Service Diesel Generator (SSDG) Circuit Breakers with industry standard (non-ruggedized) DRS circuit breakers.

[P40A / Solenoid Operated Pilot Valves (SOPVs)]: Modernizes Solenoid Operated Pilot Valves (SOPVs) with new Motor Operated Pilot Valves (MOPVs) via SCD 14864.

[P40A / Fire Detection System]: Modernizes the LSD-41/49 Fire Detection System (FDS) to correct critical and functional deficiencies within the existing system comprised of 750 heat detectors in approximately 330 compartments. The new, individually-addressable fire detection system to include smoke detectors in berthing and other spaces and new heat, smoke, and flame detector coverage throughout the ship.

[P40A / Oily Water Separator (OWS)]: Modernizes the LSD 41/49 Class Oily Water Separator (OWS).

[P40A / 80Ton AC Units]: Replace Obsolete 80 Ton AC Plant with fully supported 111 ton AC units and increased capacity.

[P40A / Modular Refrigeration System (MRS)]: Replaces legacy refrigeration system with a Modular Refrigeration System (MRS) Plant.

[P3A / ST002 -  Propeller Blades & PLMU]: Replaces the existing Propeller Blades with higher efficiency blades and installs Propulsion Load Management Units (PLMU).

[P3A - 2 / ST002 - Steering Control System]: Replaces the analog Helm and Lee Helm Steering Consoles and equipment with an electronic, computerized Steering Control System (SCS).

[P3A - 3 / ST002 - Low Pressure Air Compressor]: Replaces the Low-Pressure Air Compressors (LPAC) with modern, oil-free compressors.

[P3A - 4 / ST002 - Generators & Elect Distribution]: Replaces the generator on the Ship Service Diesel Generators (SSDG) with a higher wattage version and increased electric distribution capability for shore power, switchboard and load centers.

[P3A - 5 / ST002 - LSD Deck Crane]: Modernize the control system for the 60 and 20 Ton Cranes with a modern, electronic, computerized control system.

[P3A - 6 / ST002 - LSD Flight Deck Thermal Management System]: Provides Flight Deck Thermal Management System (FDTMS) on the flight deck to mitigate damage resulting from MV-22 vertical take off/landing (VTOL) flight operations.

[P3A - 7 / ST002 - LSD Ballast Control Console]: Provides upgrades to the existing Ballast Control Consoles (BCS) and replace legacy BCS with a Programmable Logic Controller (PLC) based digital, networked system.

Justification.val: FY 2020 increase supports LSD 41 USS Whidbey Island Phase Modernization procurements for C4I Systems, Combat Systems, and Hull Mechanical and Electrical upgrades to support delivery in time for LSD 41 FY 2022 Modernization Period Availability. Funds also support first in class Ballast Control Consoles and Deck Crane Control upgrade procurements in FY 2020 to support delivery in time for FY 2021 availabilities.

FY18 Installation is for LSD 46.

ImplementationMethodName.val: SHIPYARD/AIT:: Installation Name: FMP Ship Units

Description.val: This SHIPALT replaces the existing Propeller Blades with higher efficiency blades and installs Propulsion Load Management Units (PLMU) that result in fuel savings and engine maintenance reduction as well as operational benefits.  The prototype for this SHIPALT was installed and proven aboard the LSD 44 under the DOD sponsored Commercial Operations and Support Savings Initiative (COSSI).  Return On Investment (ROI) for the class is estimated at over $40M (after payback) and operational benefits include increased top speed, quicker response/deceleration, and elimination of existing system performance problems (i.e., low lube-oil pressure trip of main engines).  Only 9 LSDs will require this SHIPALT as part of the Midlife Program.

ImplementationMethodName.val: [none specified]:: Installation Name: Non-FMP Shore Site Units
SHIPYARD/AIT:: Installation Name: FMP Ship Units

Description.val: This SHIPALT replaces the analog Helm and Lee Helm Steering Consoles and equipment with an electronic, computerized Steering Control System (SCS) that integrates various navigation parameters, such as location (latitude, longitude) from GPS as well as pitch, roll, speed, heading, and wind.  SCS will be designed to integrate with Electronic Chart Display and Information Systems-Navy (ECDIS-N) digital nautical charts. The existing Bridge control system was designed in the late 1970s and is near the end of its useful service life.  Parts obsolescence is a rapidly growing and costlier problem on this maintenance intensive control system.  The IBS also provides significantly enhanced operational and monitoring capabilities as well as real-time Navigation data.  This system will reduce workload, provide significant readiness improvement, improve safety and provide cost avoidance.

ImplementationMethodName.val: SHIPYARD/AIT:: Installation Name: FMP Ship Units

Description.val: This Ship Change replaces the Low-Pressure Air Compressors (LPAC) with modern, oil-free compressors.   Parts obsolescence is a rapidly growing and more costly problem on these maintenance intensive compressors.  This Ship Change provides Return On Investment (ROI) through improved reliability and maintainability of LPACs and reduced maintenance by elimination of oil contamination of pneumatic controls components (new compressors are oil-free).  In addition, the new compressors will provide significant readiness improvement through increased reliability of Vital, low-pressure air supply to Vital combat systems and the main propulsion controls.

ImplementationMethodName.val: SHIPYARD/AIT:: Installation Name: FMP Ship Units

Description.val: This SHIPALT replaces the generator on the Ship Service Diesel Generators (SSDG) with a higher wattage version and increased electric distribution capability for shore power, switchboard and load centers. This SHIPALT provides significant Return on Investment (ROI) through improved reliability and maintainability of electrical ship systems/equipment versus the obsolete and maintenance intensive equipment.  Also, additional electrical plant loads will improve efficient operation of the currently under-loaded SSDGs and contribute to the ROI through reduced maintenance costs for the SSDGs.

Name.@footnote: 60T and 20T crane have identical procurement costs due to same Crane Controls, brakes, LMI (boom indicator and load cell) and Motors being procured.  This is not a crane replacement.  FY20 Procures 1 unit (60T Deck Crane Control System) for installation in FY21 for first in class install on LSD 42.
FY20 Procures one (20T Deck Crane Control System) for installation in FY21 for first in class install on LSD 42.
Name.val: 1.1.2) 20 Ton Deck Crane Control System - NonOrganic

ImplementationMethodName.val: [none specified]:: Installation Name: 60 Ton Crane Control System
[none specified]:: Installation Name: 20 Ton Deck Crane Control System

Description.val: SCD 19102 (60 Ton) and SCD 19770 (20 Ton) Crane controls upgrade - modernizes the control system for the 60 and 20 Ton Cranes with a modern, electronic, computerized control system. The existing crane control system was designed in the late 1970s and is no longer logistically supported. Maintenance costs continue to be high due to the difficulty in obtaining repair parts and frequent failure of components. This upgrade does not replace the whole crane.

ModificationTitle.val: ST002 - LSD Flight Deck Thermal Management System

Title.val: ST002 - LSD Flight Deck Thermal Management System

Name.@footnote: FY20 funds Design Services Agent (DSA) requirements in support of installation during LSD 41 Modernization Period Availability scheduled for FY22.
Name.val: 1.1.1) LSD Flight Deck Thermal Management System* - NonOrganic

ImplementationMethodName.val: [none specified]:: Installation Name: LSD Flight Deck Thermal Management System*

Description.val: The Flight Deck Thermal Management System (FDTMS) (SCD 16657) Procures and installs heat mitigating, two layer, composite panels that provides heat protection to the helicopter deck to mitigate damage resulting from MV-22 vertical take off/landing (VTOL) flight operations.

Name.@footnote: FY20 NRE funds Engineering/Non-Recurring Engineering for performing Electro-Magnetic Interference (EMI), shock and vibration testing; and for development of the formal lifecycle training Front End Analysis (FEA), development of the formal lifecycle training Navy Training System Plan (NTSP) and procurement of training equipment for the LSD controls systems Maintainer Classrooms in Norfolk and San Diego. FY21 funds completion of Integrated Logistics System documentation.
FY20 Procures 2 units for installation in FY21.

ImplementationMethodName.val: [none specified]:: Installation Name: BALLAST CONTROL CONSOLE UPGRADE*

Description.val: SCD 10828 - Ballast Control Console (BCS) - Provides upgrades to the existing Ballast Control Consoles (BCS) and replaces legacy BCS with a Programmable Logic Controller (PLC) based digital, networked system.  This mission and safety critical SCD addresses system degradation due to obsolescence issues, extensive downtime and reduced system capability/reliability. The system is currently operating in a degraded capacity and requires immediate replacement.
